Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Surgical Ventricular Reconstruction in Ischemic Heart Failure

Trial_Design.evidence: 1000 patients with ischemic heart failure were randomised

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive either CABG alone or CABG plus SVR

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was survival, assessed at 4 months postoperatively

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted using a computer-generated sequence, with allocation concealment ensured

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not feasible due to the surgical nature of the interventions

Number_Randomised.evidence: 1000 patients with ischemic heart failure were randomised

Number_Analysed.evidence: 555 underwent surgery and had paired imaging assessments

Result_Outcome.evidence: SVR resulted in improved survival compared to CABG alone

Harms.evidence: No significant adverse events were reported in either group
